name: Like our Facebook page!
description: Check out our Facebook page and “like” us to hear about more events: facebook.com/amelia32034

name: Bye Bye Birdie - Teen Musical
description: By Charles Strouse, this student version of the musical made into a movie starring Ann Margret, made into a TV special starring Jason Alexander features 30 teens from across Nassau County and live music.

name: The Roommate
description:
A lively staged reading of The Roommate by Jen Silverman. Directed by Fran Hindsley. Performed by Cynthia Riegler, Sinda Nichols, & Sue Weiner.

Story & Song Bookstore Bistro
Upstairs at THE SECOND STORY
1430 Park Avenue, Fernandina Beach, Florida

Tickets can also be purchased at Story & Song Bookstore Bistro in person or by calling 904-601-2118.

name: The Addams Family Musical
description: Based on characters created by Charles Addams, fans of the television series and the movies will love this new musical that celebrates the macabre world of Gomez, Morticia , Fester, Wednesday, Pugsley, Grandma, and Lurch. PG-13

name: Sweet Dulcimer Sounds
description:
Sunday, August 12th at 3 pm, visiting the place where she grew up, master dulcimer teacher Dinah Ansley, now living in Appalachia, will perform. Special guest Robyn Nemes, our local dulcimer teacher, will also join in.

Free and open to the public.

name: A Little Night Music
description: A Little Night Music is a musical with music and lyrics by Stephen Sondheim and book by Hugh Wheeler. Inspired by the Ingmar Bergman film Smiles of a Summer Night, it involves the romantic lives of several couples. Its title is a literal English translation of the German name for Mozart’s Serenade No. 13 for strings in G major, Eine kleine Nachtmusik. The musical includes the popular song “Send in the Clowns”.

name: Les DeMerle and Bonnie Eisele
description: Let Les & Bonnie regale you with stories of how they met, life on the road with some of the biggest names in jazz, what it’s like to perform every night at sea on a cruise ship, and more … not to mention enjoying the sweet sounds of the Les DeMerle Trio.

name: Acoustic Sessions
description:
Tom Leon – Guitar / Vocals
Dillon Basse – Guitar / Vocals
Denton Elkins – Guitar / Vocals

The third Monday of every month, head over for an acoustic music session, showcasing local, regional and even international talent. General Admission $15. Studio 209.

name: The Last Five Years
description:
The Last Five Years is a musical written by Jason Robert Brown. It premiered at Chicago’s Northlight Theatre in 2001 and was then produced Off-Broadway in March 2002. Since then it has had numerous productions both in the United States and internationally.

The story explores a five-year relationship between Jamie Wellerstein, a rising novelist, and Cathy Hiatt, a struggling actress. The show uses a form of storytelling in which Cathy’s story is told in reverse chronological order (beginning the show at the end of the marriage), and Jamie’s is told in chronological order (starting just after the couple have first met). The characters do not directly interact except for a wedding song in the middle as their timelines intersect.

name: This Girl Laughs, This Girl Cries, This Girl Does Nothing
description:
Three young sisters are left in a forest by their woodcutter father and forced to find their own way in the world. From this fairy-tale beginning, three resolutions are made — one sister walks one way to find purpose, one the other to find adventure, and the third stays right where she is to create a home. Years later, having circumnavigated the globe and fought vikings, crossed oceans, tamed wilds, and achieved greatness, the three sisters meet again, as women. A moving and irresistibly charming modern-day fairy-tale for the whole family.

Studio 209

name: Rendezvous Film Festival
description:
RFF is a 3 day Film Festival celebrating 11 years on Amelia Island, Florida September 20 – 22, 2018 with the awards ceremony / brunch on Sunday, September 23, 2018.

Rendezvous Film Festival is a celebration of Independent Filmmakers with films made in FL, around the US and Internationally. We highlight student films, Florida Filmmakers and Professional Filmmakers all in a small town atmosphere with an island vibe.
